text: [Music]
commercialization um is a kind of code
word uh in plain simple English it means
make money by doing that uh my position
has always been microcredit should be an
area for social business where you want
to help poor people get out of poverty
by doing business
you don't lose money you get your money
back but you don't make profit out of it
because entire money you want to keep it
with the poor people so that they get
out of poverty faster that's what the
interest is uh so I look at my CR Credit
in that uh Direction the other direction
is this is an interesting new emerging
area of business if you put money if you
invest your money you make a lot of
money uh I don't see that uh is a right
kind of approach because lone sharks
have been doing this for years and
generations and for ages they lend money
to the poor people and make lot of money
uh by exploiting them so microc credit
is not a new tool for exploitation
microcredit is a tool to help people get
out of poverty so if commercialization
means you make money that will say I'm
not in support of that I would rather um
discourage uh that thing to happen but
if you want to do in a business way make
some profit uh I would still allow or
admit up to a certain amount and their
interest rate issue comes in how much
you take back I say my definition of
reasonable interest rate is uh cost of
fund at the market price plus 10%
maximum so that should be the maximum of
uh interest rate that you can charge and
you will be proper micro credit program
if you go beyond that either you are
going into a risky area where you are
getting too high and after a while
if like cost of fund at market Price
Plus 15% and above if that is the
interest rate then I'll say you are in
the red area uh of Landing to the poor
because now you are moving into the lone
Shark Zone so this is the kind of uh
ground rule that I try to promote
[Music]
oh
